remarks: A partial sum of a series with positive terms is less than the infinite sum.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.)
statement:
isumltss.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isumltss.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isumltss.3 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
isumltss.4 $e |- ( ph -> A C_ Z ) $.
isumltss.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = B ) $.
isumltss.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> B e. RR+ ) $.
isumltss.7 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
isumltss $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. A B < sum_ k e. Z B ) $.
$d A k $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
